Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body, with base of handle surviving, of a buff-coloured pottery wine-jar, the fabric is light-brown in section, the interior is slightly grooved, the exterior is covered with cream-coloured slip, now much flaked away, and remains of at least two lines of black-painted hieratic text.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393516) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393516)
